articles.author: Lance Lambert
articles.title: Fortune poll: Nearly half of American travelers are reconsidering their international trips due to coronavirus fears
articles.description: To get an indication of how coronavirus fears are impacting travel, Fortune and SurveyMonkey polled more than 2,600 Americans between February 24 to 27.

articles.author: David Meyer
articles.title: The coronavirus is officially claiming its first corporate casualties
articles.description: The British airline Flybe, which was already in serious financial trouble, has gone bankrupt in part due to the coronavirus outbreak.

articles.author: eamonbarrett
articles.title: The coronavirus exposed a flaw in global supply lines. It’s time to build better ones
articles.description: Diversifying supply lines will help multinationals avoid risk but it's an opportunity to build sustainability into global manufacturing too.

articles.author: Adam Lashinsky
articles.title: Fears of the ‘worst case’ for coronavirus are growing in Silicon Valley
articles.description: The worst case? Significant outbreak could destabilize world politics.

articles.author: John Buysse
articles.title: NYC to Miami for $51: Coronavirus woes cause airlines to offer cheap airfares and discounts
articles.description: You can even get tickets from New York to London for under $500.

articles.author: Dan Catchpole
articles.title: Why travel insurance is booming during coronavirus, even though it doesn’t help flight changes and cancellations
articles.description: Interest in travel insurance policies is up as much as 300%, brokers report.

articles.author: Dan Catchpole
articles.title: Coronavirus is upending air travel. Here’s how to navigate flight cancellations, changes during the outbreak
articles.description: The disease has roiled airports worldwide, prompting flight cancellations and changes across the globe.

articles.author: Defne Gencler
articles.title: How coronavirus is rippling through travel, energy, financial markets
articles.description: As the coronavirus outbreak spreads, global markets, workplaces, and air travel continue to be throttled.

articles.author: Defne Gencler
articles.title: Lawmakers brace for potential coronavirus cases on Capitol Hill
articles.description: Members of Congress prepare for the spread of coronavirus in Capitol Hill, deemed by lawmakers as "a matter of time."

articles.author: Defne Gencler
articles.title: Hong Kong’s famed subway reeling from protests, virus Outbreak
articles.description: The city's famed subway system is seeing a drop in profits due to pro-democracy protests and the impact of coronavirus.

articles.author: Chris Morris
articles.title: Six states are still not testing for coronavirus
articles.description: U.S. territories Puerto Rico, Guam, and the Virgin Islands are also slow to begin testing for COVID-19, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

articles.author: Sy Mukherjee
articles.title: CRISPR has a milestone moment in treating blindness
articles.description: Good morning, readers. Let’s talk about something that’s not coronavirus for just one second. The world of CRISPR gene editing had a hallmark moment this week. For the first time ever, scientists have used the technology—which allows them to slice and dice po…

articles.author: Ian Mount
articles.title: Lessons from the coronavirus front lines: What doctors in Wuhan have learned about treating Covid-19
articles.description: Medical professionals who have been treating and studying Covid-19 patients in Wuhan shared their insights with reporters in Beijing on Wednesday.

articles.author: Ian Mount
articles.title: No conveyor belt sushi, cherry-blossom viewing parties: Coronavirus reshapes daily life in Japan
articles.description: The country already has more than 300 confirmed cases despite a profound lack of testing.
